```
♿  ACCESSIBILITY NOTES

• **Color contrast:** maintain WCAG AA or higher contrast; avoid relying on color alone to convey meaning.  
• **Icons:** accompany each icon with visible text labels (screen readers may not announce emoji).  
• **Alt text:** add short descriptive alt text for graphics, e.g., “Handshake icon – closing section” or “Green leaf icon – Explore step.”  
• **Fonts:** use clear sans‑serif typeface (e.g., Arial, Calibri, Open Sans); keep minimum 12 pt on print or 16 px on‐screen.  
• **Captions / transcripts:** when used in slides or videos, include plain‑text versions of all example phrases and scripts.  
• **Color‑blind readability:** verify palettes with simulators; substitute patterns or icons for distinctions if needed.  
• **Language clarity:** keep instructions in plain language; avoid jargon so users with varying literacy can engage comfortably.

💡 Accessibility ensures every participant can learn and provide empathetic conversation safely and effectively.
────────────────────────────────────────────
```
